thread.title: Disneyland Paris to be investigated for selective overcharging
thread.title_full: Disneyland Paris to be investigated for selective overcharging

title: Disneyland Paris to be investigated for selective overcharging
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Jul 29, 2015, 10:01 BST - UK Markets close in 6 hrs 29 mins Disneyland Paris to be investigated for selective overcharging By Aideen Kennedy | Sharecast â€“ 6 minutes ago 850.50 -12.00 
  The European Commission has urged French regulators to investigate Disneyland Paris for overcharging customers, after it received several complaints that British and German customers were being frozen out of certain price promotions. The allegations, if proved beyond doubt, would see the theme park in breach of the European Union's fair trading laws An EC spokesperson said European consumer centres had frequently received complaints involving unjustified differences in pricing on the grounds of nationality or residence. 
"Too often, consumers seeking to buy services or goods in another member state are prevented from getting the best price," she added. 
The launch of the investigation came a week after the European Union (EU) announced an anti-trust case against six Hollywood movie studios and broadcaster Sky (LSE: BSY.L - news ) for allegedly denying consumers access to movies and TV shows. 
Read more: EU launches anti-trust probe against six Hollywood studios, Sky (Amsterdam: BK8.AS - news ) EU formally charges Google (Xetra: A0B7FY - news ) for competition violations in web search EU must be more flexible with foreign derivatives rules, market regulator says
